publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1124# Shona Robison: Fibromyalgia Syndrome-That the Parliament notes Fibromyalgia Syndrome Awareness Week from 10 to 16 September; recognises that the condition, which affects up to 4% of the population, is frequently overlooked or minimised by health professionals; recognises the problems sufferers have in claiming appropriate benefits; supports the demand for better education and awareness-raising about the condition, and calls for more research into the condition so that Fibromyalgia Syndrome is taken seriously as the devastating "hidden" disability that it is. Supported by: Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1124# Fibromyalgia Syndrome (lodged on 22 August 2000) Michael Russell*, Christine Grahame*, Fergus Ewing*, Irene McGugan*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-1124# Shona Robison: Fibromyalgia Syndrome-That the Parliament notes Fibromyalgia Syndrome Awareness Week from 10 to 16 September; recognises that the condition, which affects up to 4% of the population, is frequently overlooked or minimised by health professionals; recognises the problems sufferers have in claiming appropriate benefits; supports the demand for better education and awareness-raising about the condition, and calls for more research into the condition so that Fibromyalgia Syndrome is taken seriously as the devastating "hidden" disability that it is. Supported by: Mrs Margaret Ewing, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Fergus Ewing, Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1124# Fibromyalgia Syndrome (lodged on 22 August 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1124# Fibromyalgia Syndrome (lodged on 22 August 2000) Alex Neil*, Richard Lochhead*

S1M-1124# Shona Robison: Fibromyalgia Syndrome-That the Parliament notes Fibromyalgia Syndrome Awareness Week from 10 to 16 September; recognises that the condition, which affects up to 4% of the population, is frequently overlooked or minimised by health professionals; recognises the problems sufferers have in claiming appropriate benefits; supports the demand for better education and awareness-raising about the condition, and calls for more research into the condition so that Fibromyalgia Syndrome is taken seriously as the devastating "hidden" disability that it is. Supported by: Mrs Margaret Ewing, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Christine Grahame, Fergus Ewing, Irene McGugan, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fiona McLeod, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead, Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-1124# Fibromyalgia Syndrome (lodged on 22 August 2000) Michael Matheson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-1124# Fibromyalgia Syndrome (lodged on 22 August 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Brian Adam*
S1M-1124# Fibromyalgia Syndrome (lodged on 22 August 2000) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
